author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Malaysia Tourism Minister asks Finance Ministry to examine fee charge by visa centre in ChinaTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Malaysia Tourism Minister asks Finance Ministry to examine fee charge by visa centre in China
Commenting on a statement made in a blogpost last Thursday by Tourism Malaysia chairman Wee Choo Keong, Malaysia Tourism and Culture Minister Datuk Seri Nazri Aziz said it was a Finance Ministry matter.
The Finance Ministry should examine the service charge imposed by the one- stop centre for Malaysian visas in China, said Aziz.
Earlier, Wee had said that every tourist from China has to pay a visa application fee of RMB80 (S$17.83) charged by the Malaysian Government, and another RMB120 as a service fee to an outfit known as SPPV One Stop Centre.
Responding to this, Nazri questioned why a private company was being allowed to do something the Government can do.
However, when asked if the outsourcing was necessary, Nazri added that it was needed because China is a big country.
Notably, under the existing conditions to come into effect in October, visa-free entry or temporary social passes will only be granted to groups of 20 or more tourists from China. The group must travel with tour operators registered with the Tourism and Culture Ministry, and members of the group will be given a temporary social pass limited to 15 days for each entry into Malaysia.
